00036 /* Parse tree nodes - this is where the expression evaluation happens.
00037 
00038    Some implementation notes: 
00039 
00040    1) Vector vs scalar - Any node can accept vector or scalar inputs
00041    and return a vector or scalar result.  If a node returns a scalar,
00042    it is only required to set the [0] component and the other
00043    components must be assumed to be invalid.
00044 
00045    2) SeExprNode::prep - This is called for all nodes during parsing
00046    once the syntax has been checked.  Anything can be done here, such
00047    as function binding, variable lookups, etc., but the only thing
00048    that must be done is to determine whether the result is going to be
00049    vector or scalar.  This can in some cases depend on whether the
00050    children are vector or scalar so the parser calls prep on the root
00051    node and each node is expected to call prep on its children and
00052    then set its own _isVec variable.  The wantVec param provides
00053    context from the parent (and ultimately the owning expression) as
00054    to whether a vector is desired, but nodes are not bound by this and
00055    may produce a scalar even when a vector is wanted.
00056    
00057    The base class method implements the default behavior which is to
00058    pass down the wantVec flag to all children and set isVec to true if
00059    any child is a vec.
00060 
00061    If the prep method fails, an error string should be set and false
00062    should be returned.
00063 */
00064 
00065 #ifndef MAKEDEPEND
00066 #include <math.h>
00067 #endif
00068 #include "SeVec3d.h"
00069 #include "SeExpression.h"
00070 #include "SeExprNode.h"
00071 #include "SeExprFunc.h"
00072

00074 SeExprNode::SeExprNode(const SeExpression* expr)
00075     : _expr(expr), _parent(0), _isVec(0)
00076 {
00077 }
00078 
00079 
00080 SeExprNode::SeExprNode(const SeExpression* expr, SeExprNode* a)
00081     : _expr(expr), _parent(0), _isVec(0)
00082 {
00083     _children.reserve(1);
00084     addChild(a);
00085 }
00086 
00087 
00088 SeExprNode::SeExprNode(const SeExpression* expr, SeExprNode* a, SeExprNode* b)
00089     : _expr(expr), _parent(0), _isVec(0)
00090 {
00091     _children.reserve(2);
00092     addChild(a);
00093     addChild(b);
00094 }
00095 
00096 
00097 SeExprNode::SeExprNode(const SeExpression* expr, SeExprNode* a, SeExprNode* b,
00098                        SeExprNode* c)
00099     : _expr(expr), _parent(0), _isVec(0)
00100 {
00101     _children.reserve(3);
00102     addChild(a);
00103     addChild(b);
00104     addChild(c);
00105 }
00106 
00107 
00108 SeExprNode::~SeExprNode()
00109 {
00110     // delete children
00111     std::vector<SeExprNode*>::iterator iter;
00112     for (iter = _children.begin(); iter != _children.end(); iter++)
00113         delete *iter;
00114 }
00115 
00116 
00117 void
00118 SeExprNode::addChild(SeExprNode* child)
00119 {
00120     _children.push_back(child);
00121     child->_parent = this;
00122 }
00123 
00124 
00125 void
00126 SeExprNode::addChildren(SeExprNode* surrogate)
00127 {
00128     std::vector<SeExprNode*>::iterator iter;
00129     for (iter = surrogate->_children.begin();
00130          iter != surrogate->_children.end(); 
00131          iter++)
00132     {
00133         addChild(*iter);
00134     }
00135     surrogate->_children.clear();
00136     delete surrogate;
00137 }
00138 
00139 
00140 bool
00141 SeExprNode::prep(bool wantVec, std::string& error)
00142 {
00143     /* The default behavior is to pass down the wantVec flag to
00144        all children and set isVec to true if any child is a vec. */
00145     bool valid=true;
00146     std::vector<SeExprNode*>::iterator iter;
00147     _isVec = 0;
00148     for (iter = _children.begin(); iter != _children.end(); iter++) {
00149         SeExprNode* child = *iter;
00150         if (!child->prep(wantVec, error)) valid=false;
00151         if (child->isVec()) _isVec = 1;
00152     }
00153     return valid;
00154 }
00155 
00156 
00157 void
00158 SeExprNode::eval(SeVec3d& result) const
00159 {
00160     // the default behavior is to just eval all the children for
00161     // their side-effects (i.e. setting variables)
00162     // there is no result value
00163     SeVec3d val;
00164     for (int i = 0; i < numChildren(); i++)
00165         child(i)->eval(val);
00166     result = 0.0;
00167 }
00168 
00169 
00170 bool
00171 SeExprBlockNode::prep(bool wantVec, std::string& error)
00172 {
00173     // prepare variable assignments (request vector type)
00174     bool valid=true;
00175 
00176     if (!child(0)->prep(1, error)) valid=false;
00177 
00178     // prepare expression
00179     if (!child(1)->prep(wantVec, error)) valid=false;
00180 
00181     _isVec = child(1)->isVec();
00182     return valid;
00183 }
00184 
00185 
00186 void
00187 SeExprBlockNode::eval(SeVec3d& result) const
00188 {
00189     // eval block, then eval primary expr
00190     SeVec3d val;
00191     child(0)->eval(val);
00192     child(1)->eval(result);
00193 }
00194 
00195 
00196 bool
00197 SeExprIfThenElseNode::prep(bool wantVec, std::string& error)
00198 {
00199     bool valid=true;
00200     // prepare condition expression (request vector type)
00201     if (!child(0)->prep(0, error)) valid=false;
00202 
00203     // prepare then/else blocks
00204     if (!child(1)->prep(1, error)) valid=false;
00205     if (!child(2)->prep(1, error)) valid=false;
00206     _isVec = 0;
00207     return valid;
00208 }
00209 
00210 
00211 void
00212 SeExprIfThenElseNode::eval(SeVec3d& result) const
00213 {
00214     // eval condition, then choose then/else block
00215     SeVec3d val;
00216     child(0)->eval(val);
00217     if (val[0])
00218         child(1)->eval(val);
00219     else
00220         child(2)->eval(val);
00221     result = 0.0;
00222 }

00224 
00225 bool
00226 SeExprAssignNode::prep(bool wantVec, std::string& error)
00227 {
00228     // prepare expression
00229     if (!child(0)->prep(1, error)) return 0;
00230     _isVec = child(0)->isVec();
00231 
00232     // add to var table
00233     _var = _expr->getLocalVar(_name.c_str());
00234     if (_isVec) _var->setIsVec();
00235     return 1;
00236 }
00237 
00238 
00239 void
00240 SeExprAssignNode::eval(SeVec3d& result) const
00241 {
00242     if (_var) {
00243         // eval expression and store in variable
00244         const SeExprNode* node = child(0);
00245         node->eval(_var->val);
00246         if (_var->isVec() && !node->isVec())
00247             result[1] = result[2] = result[0];
00248     }
00249     else result = 0.0;
00250 }

00252 
00253 bool
00254 SeExprVecNode::prep(bool wantVec, std::string& error)
00255 {
00256     // want scalar children, result is vector
00257     if (!SeExprNode::prep(0, error)) return 0;
00258     _isVec = wantVec;
00259     return 1;
00260 }
00261 
00262 
00263 void
00264 SeExprVecNode::eval(SeVec3d& result) const
00265 {
00266     if (_isVec) {
00267         SeVec3d v;
00268         child(0)->eval(v); result[0] = v[0];
00269         child(1)->eval(v); result[1] = v[0];
00270         child(2)->eval(v); result[2] = v[0];
00271     } else {
00272         child(0)->eval(result);
00273     }
00274 }
00275 
00276 
00277 bool
00278 SeExprCondNode::prep(bool wantVec, std::string& error)
00279 {
00280     bool valid=true;
00281     // want scalar condition, result can be scalar or vector
00282     if (!child(0)->prep(0, error)) valid=false;
00283     if (!child(1)->prep(wantVec, error)) valid=false;
00284     if (!child(2)->prep(wantVec, error)) valid=false;
00285     _isVec = wantVec && (child(1)->isVec() || child(2)->isVec());
00286     return valid;
00287 }
00288 
00289 
00290 void
00291 SeExprCondNode::eval(SeVec3d& result) const
00292 {
00293     SeVec3d v;
00294     child(0)->eval(v);
00295     const SeExprNode* node = v[0] ? child(1) : child(2);
00296     node->eval(result);
00297     if (_isVec && !node->isVec())
00298         result[1] = result[2] = result[0];
00299 }

00302 bool
00303 SeExprAndNode::prep(bool wantVec, std::string& error)
00304 {
00305     // want scalar children, result is scalar
00306     if (!SeExprNode::prep(0, error)) return 0;
00307     _isVec = 0;
00308     return 1;
00309 }
00310 
00311 
00312 void
00313 SeExprAndNode::eval(SeVec3d& result) const
00314 {
00315     // operands and result must be scalar
00316     SeVec3d a, b;
00317     child(0)->eval(a);
00318     if (!a[0]) {
00319         result[0] = 0;
00320     } else { 
00321         child(1)->eval(b);
00322         result[0] = (b[0] != 0.0); 
00323     }
00324 }

00327 bool
00328 SeExprOrNode::prep(bool wantVec, std::string& error)
00329 {
00330     // want scalar children, result is scalar
00331     if (!SeExprNode::prep(0, error)) return 0;
00332     _isVec = 0;
00333     return 1;
00334 }

00336 
00337 void
00338 SeExprOrNode::eval(SeVec3d& result) const
00339 {
00340     // operands and result must be scalar
00341     SeVec3d a, b;
00342     child(0)->eval(a);
00343     if (a[0]) {
00344         result[0] = 1;
00345     } else { 
00346         child(1)->eval(b);
00347         result[0] = (b[0] != 0.0); 
00348     }
00349 }

00351 
00352 bool
00353 SeExprSubscriptNode::prep(bool wantVec, std::string& error)
00354 {
00355     bool valid=true;
00356     // want vector first child and scalar second child
00357     // result is scalar
00358     if (!child(0)->prep(1, error)) valid=false;
00359     if (!child(1)->prep(0, error)) valid=false;
00360     _isVec = 0;
00361     return valid;
00362 }
00363 
00364 
00365 void
00366 SeExprSubscriptNode::eval(SeVec3d& result) const
00367 {
00368     const SeExprNode* child0 = child(0);
00369     const SeExprNode* child1 = child(1);
00370     SeVec3d a, b;
00371     child0->eval(a);
00372     child1->eval(b);
00373     int index = int(b[0]);
00374 
00375     if (child0->isVec()) {
00376         switch(index) {
00377         case 0:  result[0] = a[0]; break;
00378         case 1:  result[0] = a[1]; break;
00379         case 2:  result[0] = a[2]; break;
00380         default: result[0] = 0; break;
00381         }
00382     } else {
00383         switch(index) {
00384         case 0:
00385         case 1:
00386         case 2:  result[0] = a[0]; break;
00387         default: result[0] = 0; break;
00388         }
00389     }
00390 }
00391 
00392 
00393 void
00394 SeExprNegNode::eval(SeVec3d& result) const
00395 {
00396     SeVec3d a;
00397     const SeExprNode* child0 = child(0);
00398     child0->eval(a);
00399     result[0] = -a[0];
00400     if (_isVec) {
00401         result[1] = -a[1];
00402         result[2] = -a[2];
00403     }
00404 }

00407 void
00408 SeExprInvertNode::eval(SeVec3d& result) const
00409 {
00410     SeVec3d a;
00411     const SeExprNode* child0 = child(0);
00412     child0->eval(a);
00413     result[0] = 1-a[0];
00414     if (_isVec) {
00415         result[1] = 1-a[1];
00416         result[2] = 1-a[2];
00417     }
00418 }

00421 void
00422 SeExprNotNode::eval(SeVec3d& result) const
00423 {
00424     SeVec3d a;
00425     const SeExprNode* child0 = child(0);
00426     child0->eval(a);
00427     result[0] = !a[0];
00428     if (_isVec) {
00429         result[1] = !a[1];
00430         result[2] = !a[2];
00431     }
00432 }

00434 
00435 bool
00436 SeExprCompareEqNode::prep(bool wantVec, std::string& error)
00437 {
00438     wantVec = true; // children can be vector for ==, !=
00439     if (!SeExprNode::prep(wantVec, error)) return 0;
00440     _isVec = 0; // result is always scalar
00441     return 1;
00442 }
00443 
00444 
00445 bool
00446 SeExprCompareNode::prep(bool wantVec, std::string& error)
00447 {
00448 
00449     wantVec = false; // for <, >, <=, >=, only scalar values are used
00450     if (!SeExprNode::prep(wantVec, error)) return 0;
00451     _isVec = 0; // result is always scalar
00452     return 1;
00453 }
00454 
00455 
00456 void
00457 SeExprEqNode::eval(SeVec3d& result) const
00458 {
00459     SeVec3d a, b;
00460     const SeExprNode* child0 = child(0);
00461     const SeExprNode* child1 = child(1);
00462     child0->eval(a);
00463     child1->eval(b);
00464 
00465     if (!child0->isVec()) a[1] = a[2] = a[0];
00466     if (!child1->isVec()) b[1] = b[2] = b[0];
00467     result[0] = a[0] == b[0] && a[1] == b[1] && a[2] == b[2];
00468 }
00469 
00470 
00471 void
00472 SeExprNeNode::eval(SeVec3d& result) const
00473 {
00474     SeVec3d a, b;
00475     const SeExprNode* child0 = child(0);
00476     const SeExprNode* child1 = child(1);
00477     child0->eval(a);
00478     child1->eval(b);
00479 
00480     if (!child0->isVec()) a[1] = a[2] = a[0];
00481     if (!child1->isVec()) b[1] = b[2] = b[0];
00482     result[0] = a[0] != b[0] || a[1] != b[1] || a[2] != b[2];
00483 }

00494 
00495     result[0] = a[0] < b[0];

00537 
00538 void
00539 SeExprAddNode::eval(SeVec3d& result) const
00540 {
00541     const SeExprNode* child0 = child(0);
00542     const SeExprNode* child1 = child(1);
00543     SeVec3d a, b;
00544     child0->eval(a);
00545     child1->eval(b);
00546 
00547     if (!_isVec) {
00548         result[0] = a[0] + b[0];
00549     }
00550     else {
00551         // at least one child is a vector and the result is too
00552         if (!child0->isVec()) a[1] = a[2] = a[0];
00553         if (!child1->isVec()) b[1] = b[2] = b[0];
00554         result = a + b;
00555     }
00556 }

00558 
00559 void
00560 SeExprSubNode::eval(SeVec3d& result) const
00561 {
00562     const SeExprNode* child0 = child(0);
00563     const SeExprNode* child1 = child(1);
00564     SeVec3d a, b;
00565     child0->eval(a);
00566     child1->eval(b);
00567 
00568     if (!_isVec) {
00569         result[0] = a[0] - b[0];
00570     }
00571     else {
00572         // at least one child is a vector and the result is too
00573         if (!child0->isVec()) a[1] = a[2] = a[0];
00574         if (!child1->isVec()) b[1] = b[2] = b[0];
00575         result = a - b;
00576     }
00577 }

00580 void
00581 SeExprMulNode::eval(SeVec3d& result) const
00582 {
00583     const SeExprNode* child0 = child(0);
00584     const SeExprNode* child1 = child(1);
00585     SeVec3d a, b;
00586     child0->eval(a);
00587     child1->eval(b);
00588 
00589     if (!_isVec) {
00590         result[0] = a[0] * b[0];
00591     }
00592     else {
00593         // at least one child is a vector and the result is too
00594         if (!child0->isVec()) a[1] = a[2] = a[0];
00595         if (!child1->isVec()) b[1] = b[2] = b[0];
00596         result = a * b;
00597     }
00598 }

00601 void
00602 SeExprDivNode::eval(SeVec3d& result) const
00603 {
00604     const SeExprNode* child0 = child(0);
00605     const SeExprNode* child1 = child(1);
00606     SeVec3d a, b;
00607     child0->eval(a);
00608     child1->eval(b);
00609 
00610     if (!_isVec) {
00611         result[0] = a[0] / b[0];
00612     }
00613     else {
00614         // at least one child is a vector and the result is too
00615         if (!child0->isVec()) a[1] = a[2] = a[0];
00616         if (!child1->isVec()) b[1] = b[2] = b[0];
00617         result = a / b;
00618     }
00619 }
00620 
00621 
00622 static double niceMod(double a, double b)
00623 {
00624     if (b == 0) return 0;
00625     return a - floor(a/b)*b;
00626 }
00627 
00628 
00629 void
00630 SeExprModNode::eval(SeVec3d& result) const
00631 {
00632     const SeExprNode* child0 = child(0);
00633     const SeExprNode* child1 = child(1);
00634     SeVec3d a, b;
00635     child0->eval(a);
00636     child1->eval(b);
00637 
00638     if (!_isVec) {
00639         result[0] = niceMod(a[0], b[0]);
00640     }
00641     else {
00642         // at least one child is a vector and the result is too
00643         if (!child0->isVec()) a[1] = a[2] = a[0];
00644         if (!child1->isVec()) b[1] = b[2] = b[0];
00645         result[0] = niceMod(a[0], b[0]);
00646         result[1] = niceMod(a[1], b[1]);
00647         result[2] = niceMod(a[2], b[2]);
00648     }
00649 }
00650 
00651 
00652 void
00653 SeExprExpNode::eval(SeVec3d& result) const
00654 {
00655     const SeExprNode* child0 = child(0);
00656     const SeExprNode* child1 = child(1);
00657     SeVec3d a, b;
00658     child0->eval(a);
00659     child1->eval(b);
00660 
00661     if (!_isVec) {
00662         result[0] = pow(a[0], b[0]);
00663     }
00664     else {
00665         // at least one child is a vector and the result is too
00666         if (!child0->isVec()) a[1] = a[2] = a[0];
00667         if (!child1->isVec()) b[1] = b[2] = b[0];
00668         result[0] = pow(a[0], b[0]);
00669         result[1] = pow(a[1], b[1]);
00670         result[2] = pow(a[2], b[2]);
00671     }
00672 }

00674 
00675 bool
00676 SeExprVarNode::prep(bool wantVec, std::string& error)
00677 {
00678     // ask expression to resolve var
00679     _var = _expr->resolveLocalVar(name());
00680     if (!_var) _var = _expr->resolveVar(name());
00681     if (!_var) {
00682         addError(std::string("No variable named $")+name());
00683         return 0;
00684     }
00685     _isVec = _var->isVec();
00686     return 1;
00687 }
00688 
00689 
00690 void
00691 SeExprVarNode::eval(SeVec3d& result) const
00692 {
00693     if (_var) _var->eval(this, result);
00694     else result = 0.0;
00695 }
00696 
00697 
00698 bool
00699 SeExprFuncNode::prep(bool wantVec, std::string& error)
00700 {
00701     // ask expression to resolve func
00702     _func = _expr->resolveFunc(_name);
00703     // otherwise, look in global func table
00704     if (!_func) _func = SeExprFunc::lookup(_name);
00705     if (!_func) {
00706         addError("No function named "+_name);
00707         return 0;
00708     }
00709 
00710     _nargs = numChildren();
00711     if (_nargs < _func->minArgs()) {
00712         addError("Too few args for function "+_name);
00713         return 0;
00714     }
00715     if (_nargs > _func->maxArgs() && _func->maxArgs() >= 0) {
00716         addError("Too many args for function "+_name);
00717         return 0;
00718     }
00719 
00720     // alloc storage for args
00721     _scalarArgs.resize(_nargs);
00722     _vecArgs.resize(_nargs);
00723 
00724     // funcx is a catchall that does all its own processing
00725     if (_func->type() == SeExprFunc::FUNCX) {
00726         _isVec = 1; // assume vec result - funcx can override
00727         if(!_func->funcx()->isThreadSafe()) _expr->setThreadUnsafe(_name);
00728         return _func->funcx()->prep(this, wantVec, error);
00729     }
00730 
00731     // if a vector result is wanted or the function expects vector args,
00732     // then prepare the arguments for vector evaluation
00733     if (!SeExprNode::prep(wantVec || _func->hasVecArgs(), error)){
00734         // TODO: remove this once string argument is gone
00735         if(error!="") addError(error);
00736         error=""; // remove error so it isn't double reported
00737         return 0;
00738     }
00739     
00740     // a vector result will be produced if a vector result is wanted
00741     // and the either the function can produce a vector or the function
00742     // is purely scalar but one or more args are vectors.
00743     _isVec = 0;
00744     if (wantVec) {
00745         if (_func->isVec()) _isVec = 1;
00746         else if (!_func->hasVecArgs()) {
00747             for (int i = 0; i < _nargs; i++)
00748                 if (child(i)->isVec()) { _isVec = 1; break; }
00749         }
00750     }
00751     return 1;
00752 }
00753 
00754 SeVec3d*
00755 SeExprFuncNode::evalArgs() const
00756 {
00757     SeVec3d* a = vecArgs();
00758     for (int i = 0; i < _nargs; i++) {
00759         const SeExprNode* child = SeExprNode::child(i);
00760         SeVec3d& A = a[i];
00761         child->eval(A);
00762         if (!child->isVec()) A[1] = A[2] = A[0];
00763     }
00764     return a;
00765 }
00766 
00767 SeVec3d
00768 SeExprFuncNode::evalArg(int n) const
00769 {
00770     SeVec3d arg;
00771     const SeExprNode* child = SeExprNode::child(n);
00772     child->eval(arg);
00773     if (!child->isVec()) arg[1] = arg[2] = arg[0];
00774     return arg;
00775 }
00776 
00777 bool
00778 SeExprFuncNode::isStrArg(int n) const
00779 {
00780     return n < _nargs && dynamic_cast<const SeExprStrNode*>(child(n)) != 0;
00781 }
00782 
00783 std::string
00784 SeExprFuncNode::getStrArg(int n) const
00785 {
00786     if (n < _nargs)
00787         return static_cast<const SeExprStrNode*>(child(n))->str();
00788     return "";
00789 }
00790 
00791 
00792 void
00793 SeExprFuncNode::eval(SeVec3d& result) const
00794 {
00795     if (!_func) { result = 0.0; return; }
00796 
00797     // funcx is a catchall that does all its own processing
00798     if (_func->type() == SeExprFunc::FUNCX) {
00799         _func->funcx()->eval(this, result);
00800         return;
00801     }
00802 
00803     // handle the case of a scalar func applied to a vector
00804     bool applyScalarToVec = _isVec && !_func->isVec();
00805     int niter = applyScalarToVec ? 3 : 1;
00806 
00807     // eval args and call the function
00808     SeVec3d* a = evalArgs();
00809     for (int i = 0; i < niter; i++) {
00810         switch (_func->type()) {
00811         default: 
00812             result[i] = result[1] = result[2] = 0;
00813             break;
00814         case SeExprFunc::FUNC0:
00815             result[i] = _func->func0()(); 
00816             break;
00817         case SeExprFunc::FUNC1:
00818             result[i] = _func->func1()(a[0][i]);
00819             break;
00820         case SeExprFunc::FUNC2:
00821             result[i] = _func->func2()(a[0][i], a[1][i]);
00822             break;
00823         case SeExprFunc::FUNC3:
00824             result[i] = _func->func3()(a[0][i], a[1][i], a[2][i]);
00825             break;
00826         case SeExprFunc::FUNC4:
00827             result[i] = _func->func4()(a[0][i], a[1][i], a[2][i], a[3][i]);
00828             break;
00829         case SeExprFunc::FUNC5:
00830             result[i] = _func->func5()(a[0][i], a[1][i], a[2][i], a[3][i],
00831                                        a[4][i]);
00832             break;
00833         case SeExprFunc::FUNC6:
00834             result[i] = _func->func6()(a[0][i], a[1][i], a[2][i], a[3][i],
00835                                        a[4][i], a[5][i]);
00836             break;
00837         case SeExprFunc::FUNCN: 
00838             {
00839                 double* d = scalarArgs();
00840                 for (int n = 0; n < _nargs; n++) d[n] = a[n][i];
00841                 result[i] = _func->funcn()(_nargs, d);
00842                 break;
00843             }
00844         case SeExprFunc::FUNC1V:
00845             result[i] = _func->func1v()(a[0]);
00846             break;
00847         case SeExprFunc::FUNC2V:
00848             result[i] = _func->func2v()(a[0], a[1]);
00849             break;
00850         case SeExprFunc::FUNCNV: 
00851             result[i] = _func->funcnv()(_nargs, a);
00852             break;
00853         case SeExprFunc::FUNC1VV:
00854             result = _func->func1vv()(a[0]);
00855             break;
00856         case SeExprFunc::FUNC2VV:
00857             result = _func->func2vv()(a[0], a[1]);
00858             break;
00859         case SeExprFunc::FUNCNVV: 
00860             result = _func->funcnvv()(_nargs, a);
00861             break;
00862         }
00863     }
00864 
00865 }
Generated on 3 May 2011 for SeExpr by  1.6.1
